text: Michael Keith Deaver (April 11, 1938 â€“ August 18, 2007) was an American politician. He was a member of President Ronald Reagan's White House staff as White House Deputy Chief of Staff under James Baker III and Donald Regan from January 1981 until May 1985. On March 18, 1987, Deaver was convicted of perjury for congressional testimony he had submitted. | Deaver Is Sentenced To Suspended Term And $100,000 Fine | PHILIP SHENON | SPECIAL TO THE NEW YORK TIMES | He was convicted on three of five counts of perjury. He was sentenced to three years in prison, but the sentence was reduced to three years of probation. Deaver died of pancreatic cancer on August 18, 2007, at age 69 at his home in Bethesda, Maryland. ==References== Category:1938 births Category:2007 deaths Category:Politicians from Bakersfield, California Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians Category:Deaths from pancreatic cancer
